column1: Some are: - Shorter stay in the hospital - Faster recovery - No surgery - Lower risk for infections - Less chance you will need a blood transfusion - You may avoid future C-sections -- a good thing for women who want to have more children
There is also a greater risk of getting an infection in the uterus.
- The cut on your uterus from a past C-section should be what is called low-transverse.
- You should have no past history of ruptures of your uterus or scars from other surgeries.
Your health care provider will want to make sure your pelvis is large enough for a vaginal birth and will monitor you to see if you have a big baby.
